assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.en: Parallel programming classification and techniques: instruction-level, data and task parallelism; implicit and explicit parallelism. Overview of concurrency models: declarative, message-passing, shared-state. Concepts of concurrent programming languages: pure functions, single assignment variables, dataflow driven execution, futures, green threads.
description.et: Paralleelprogrammeerimise klassifikatsioon ja tehnikad: käsutaseme, andme- ja ülesandetasemeline paralleelsus; kaudne ja otsene paralleelsus. Ülevaade paralleelsuse mudelitest: deklaratiivne, sõnumiedastuse, jagatud olekumudelid. Paralleelprogrammeerimiskeelte kontseptsioonid: puhtad funktsioonid, ühekordselt omistatavad muutujad, andmevoopõhine täitmine, futuurid, rohelised lõimed.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to teach students parallel programming in practice. The course aims to use a variety of programming languages. Students should be able to program in at least one of them.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on õpetada üliõpilastele paralleelprogrammeerimist praktikas. Kursuse eesmärk on kasutada erinevaid programmeerimiskeeli. Üliõpilased peaksid suutma programmeerida vähemalt ühes neist.

learning_outcomes.en: -Understand the properties of programming languages needed for parallel programming
-Classify languages according to their support for parallel programming
-Implement parallel programs in different programming languages, using their features as appropriate
-Understand how the programs relate to the possibilities and limitations
